output_list.criticism: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The setPrices function has a global random variable, which is susceptible to the RANDORAC/ECIPAM attack.
The sell function has an integer overflow where the amount of the user's assets are used to sell his tokens, but the user's assets are not checked for balance.
The buy function has an integer overflow where the amount of the user's assets are used to buy his tokens, but the user's assets are not checked for balance.
